answers.answer: Hello,Ketonuria can occur in pregnancy but your diabetic status and stress caused by wisdom tooth may also be causing ketonuria. During pregnancy, early detection of ketonuria is important because of the risks that are associated with intrauterine death of the fetus. Hence ketone levels which can rise even in early pregnancy should be thought of and your pregnancy status checked.Most home pregnancy tests that check urine beta-HCG are sensitive to 20-25 mIU/ml of HCG. The test can be positive anywhere from about 2-3 days prior to a missed menses to 4-5 days after, but usually it should be done 7-10 days past your missed period. It is not uncommon for women to have negative pregnancy tests when they are pregnant.Hence it is better to get serum HCG levels done.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: I have type 1 diabetes. I started birth control three weeks ago. I have been having safe sex all but once and it ws very short and he did NOT ejaculate. Now being about 2 weeks since having sex I got my wisdom teeth out, I was put under, and have been having high blood sugars (250 or above) that I cannot get down since. I checked my ketones and in the morning and they were high but during the day they aren't. If possibly pregnant how far along do you have to be to have ketones show? please any advice would be great. I don't know if its because of my wisdom teeth or any other possibilities..
title: Ketone question HELP
